column4: what could cause larger downloads to stall? Only happens on the Ubuntu box. All connected with WiFi
what kind of downloads?
HTTP?  TOrrents?
AxeZ, some modems act as router/firewalls
about anything.. from live cd's to dj mixes
larger files
not what you are downloading ut HOW
e.g. torrents, HTTP, etc.
just http
happens with chromium, chrome and firefox
could be your ISP throttling traffic, unlikely to be browser related anyway
the windows pc's work fine
what's your network setup like?
i'm guessing you have a wifi router?  do you retain internet connection and only the download is stalled?
yes, its wifi
wifi = modem, and pc is dualboot with windows 7. windows 7 works fine
you mean your routers is your modem, like a 2wire sbc or something?
so its really an ubuntu issue, could it have something to do with the wifi encryption? its WPA-2. I also notice radio streams drop
its a modem with wifi added. no hubs or forwarders or anything
sounds like a driver issue, what's your wifi card?
what's the model number on your modem/router and wifi card on your PC
and brand
modem = davolink 2020 (cant do anything to it, its completely locked down by the ISP, tards)
